Description: Leather footwear with a sandal-like front part and a closed heel. The sole is swayed for the left foot and consists of three layers secured with leather thong stitches along the edge as well as with three rows lengthwise down the centre. The insole is decorated with impressed rosettes, roughly extending halfway the length of the sole (seen from the front). The edge of the upper inserts between the insole and midsole. The medial part is rounded, and the lateral part extends as a narrow strip toward the front, where it was attached to the sole, forming toe bands: one for the big toe and one for the remaining toes. The upper is decorated with impressed motifs and a vertical series of slits.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: John de Monins Johnson
Dimensions: Height: 55 millimetres (upper at the beginning of instep (left))
Bibliographic references: O'Connell et al 2014 / Antinoupolis at the British Museum (21)
